intro: Iria elata, commonly known as the tall iria, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its tall, slender stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. Iria elata typically grows in wetlands and along the edges of ponds, thriving in moist, sandy soils. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological studies and wetland conservation efforts.
